courseSection0.text:
College of Arts and Humanities
English Department

Department Chair: James Campbell
407-823-5596

Admission Requirements
None
Certificate Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0:
Complete the following: 
LIN4680 - Modern English Grammar (3)
courseSection0.text1:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
CRW4722 - Editing for Creative Writers (3)
ENC4293 - Documentation and Project Management (3)
ENG4832 - Scholarly Editing & Publishing (3)
courseSection0.text2:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
ENC4218 - Visual Technical Communication (3)
GRA2101C - Introduction to Computer Art (3)
courseSection0.text3:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
CRW3950 - Cypress Dome Editorship (3)
CRW4724 - The Florida Review (3)
ENC4294 - Client-Based Project Management (3)
Any other approved Internship Credit Hours: 3

courseSection1.text0: A list of approved restricted elective courses is found in the myKnight audit.
courseSection1.text1:
Complete at least 1 of the following: 
ENC4215 - Document Design and Publication (3)
ENC4280 - Technical Writing Style (3)
ENG3817 - Digital Archives (3)
LIN4105 - History of the English Language (3)
LIN4801 - Language and Meaning (3)
courseSection1.text2: A second semester of approved Internship (especially CRW 3950 or CRW 4724) Credit Hours: 3
courseSection1.text3: Allowable substitutions for the Restricted Elective for Dept of Writing & Rhetoric students include LIN 3673, ENC 4212, or ENC 4353.

li.Earn a grade of \"C\" (2.0) or better in: Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
li.At least 12 hours used in the certificat: At least 12 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
li.No more than 6 hours can overlap with co: No more than 6 hours can overlap with courses used to satisfy the English major.
li.Course substitutions may be accepted upo: Course substitutions may be accepted upon approval of the advisor.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements

Earn a grade of "C" (2.0) or better in all courses used to satisfy the certificate.
At least 12 hours used in the certificate must be earned at UCF within the College of Arts and Humanities.
No more than 6 hours can overlap with courses used to satisfy the English major.
Course substitutions may be accepted upon approval of the advisor.
